intro: Muelleranthus, commonly known as the "devil's flower," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. These plants are characterized by their small, often showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. They are native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where they typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments. Muelleranthus species are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in sandy or rocky habitats. Their botanical features include trifoliate leaves and pods that contain several seeds, contributing to their ecological adaptability.
